label: ABC4_cF24_216_a_b_e-001
title: High-Temperature Cubic KClO$_{4}$ ($H0_{5}$) Structure
comments:
This is the high-temperature phase of the listed perchlorate structures. KClO$_{4}$ transforms from its \href{current_web_home_dir/AB4C_oP24_62_c_2cd_c-001}{ground-state orthorhombic structure, $H0_{2}$} into this structure at $299.5^{\circ}$C. The transition temperature for the other compounds range from $155^{\circ}$C (AgClO$_{4}$) to $308^{\circ}$C (NaClO$_{4}$). 
 The lattice constant for KClO$_{4}$ was measured at $310^{\circ}$C.
